gurmukhi: ਭਾਜ ਜੈਹੈ ਕਹਾਂ ਬਾਟਿ ਪੈਹੈਂ ੳੂਹਾਂ ਮਾਰਿਹੌ ਬਾਜ ਜੈਸੇ ਬਟੇਰੇ ||੩੮੬||
transliteration: Bhaaj Jaihai Kahaan Baattee Padhhain Oohaan Daar(i)hau Baaj Jaise Badere||386||
translation: Ram will not even get passage for running away, wherever I shall find him, I shall kill him there like a flacon killing a quil.386.

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕ ੲੇਕੰ ਹਿਰੈਂ ਝੂਮ ਝੂਮੰ ਮਰੈਂ ਅਾਪੁ ਅਾਪੰ ਗਿਰੈਂ ਹਾਕੁ ਮਾਰੇ ||
transliteration: Ek Ekan Hirain Jhoom Jhooman Darain Aap(u) Aapan Girain Haak(u) Mdare||
translation: I shall search for each one and kill him, and all of them will fall down on listening to my challenge;

gurmukhi: ਲਾਗ ਜੈਹੱੳੁ ਤਹਾਂ ਭਾਜ ਜੈਹੈ ਜਹਾਂ ਫੂਲ ਜੈਹੈ ਕਹਾਂ ਤੈ ੳੁਬਾਰੇ ||
transliteration: Laag Jaihau Tahaan Bhaaj Jaihai Jahaan Phool Jaihai Kahaan Tai Oubhare||
translation: Wherever they will run to, shall pursue them and reach there, they shall not be able to conceal themselves.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਜ ਬਾਜੇ ਸਭੈ ਅਾਜ ਲੈਹੱੳੁਂ ਤਿਨੈ ਰਾਜ ਕੈਸੋ ਕਰੈ ਕਾਜ ਮੋਸੋ ||
transliteration: Saaj Baaje Sabhai Aaj Laihaoun Tinai Raaj Kaiso Kaaj Moso||
translation: After bedecking myself, I shall catch them today and my whole work will be accomplished by my men.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਨਰੰ ਛੈ ਕਰੋ ਰਾਮ ਲੱਛੈ ਹਰੋ ਜੀਤ ਹੌ ਹੋਡ ਤੳੁ ਤਾਨ ਤੋਸੋ ||੩੮੭||
transliteration: Baanaran Chhai Daro Raam Lachchhai Daro Jeet Hau Hod Tau Taan Toso||387||
translation: I shall destroy the army of monkeys, I shall kill ram and Lakshman and after conquering them I shall break to pieces your arrogance.387.

gurmukhi: ਕੋਟਿ ਬਾਤੈ ਗੁਨੀ ੲੇਕ ਕੈ ਨਾ ਸੁਨੀ ਕੋਪਿ ਮੁੰਡੀ ਧੁਨੀ ਪੁੱਤ ਪੱਠੈ ||
transliteration: Kottee Baatai Gouniek Kai Naa Sounilop(i) Mounndidhounipoutt Patthai||
translation: Many things were said but Ravana paid a deaf ear to them and highly infuriated, he sent his sons to war-arena;

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕ ਨਾਰਾਂਤ ਦੇਵਾਂਤ ਦੁਜੋ ਬਲੀ ਭੂਮ ਕੰਪੀ ਰਣੰਬੀਰ ੳੁੱਠੈ ||
transliteration: Ek Naaraant Devaant Dujo Balibhoom Kanpirananbeer Outthai||
translation: One of them was Narant and the other Devant, they were mighty warriors, on seeing whom the earth trembled,

gurmukhi: ਸਾਰ ਭਾਰੰ ਪਰੇ ਧਾਰ ਧਾਰੰ ਬਜੀ ਕ੍ਰੋਹ ਕੈ ਲੋਹ ਕੀ ਛਿੱਟ ਛੁੱਟੈਂ ||
transliteration: Saar Bhaaran Dare Dhaar Dhaaran Bajikroh Kai Loh Kichhitt Chhouttain||
translation: The steel struck with steel and with the shower of arrows, there was splash of blood;

gurmukhi: ਰੁੰਡ ਧੁਕਧੁਕ ਪਰੈ ਘਾੲਿ ਭਕਭਕ ਕਰੈ ਬਿੱਥਰੀ ਜੁੱਥ ਸੋ ਲੁੱਥ ਲੁੱਟੈਂ ||੩੮੮||
transliteration: Round Dhouk-dhouk Darai Ghaae Bhak-bhak Darai Bithharijoutth So Loutth Louttain||388||
translation: The headless trunks writhed, the blood gushed out of the wounds and the corpses were scattered here and there.388.

gurmukhi: ਪੱਤ੍ਰ ਜੁੱਗਣ ਭਰੈ ਸੱਦ ਦੇਵੀ ਕਰੈ ਨੱਦ ਭੈਰੋ ਰਰੈ ਗੀਤ ਗਾਵੈ ||
transliteration: Pattra Judgad Bdarai Sadd Devidarai Nadd Bhairo Darai Geet Gadvai||
translation: The Yoginis filled their bowls with blood and began to call out for the goddess kali, Bhairavas began to sing songs with terrible sounds.

gurmukhi: ਭੂਤ ਅੌ ਪ੍ਰੇਤ ਬੈਤਾਲ ਬੀਰੰ ਬਲੀ ਮਾਸ ਅਹਾਰ ਤਾਰੀ ਬਜਾਵੈ ||
transliteration: Bhoot Au Prêt Baitaal Bderan Balimaas Ahaar Taaribajaavai||
translation: The ghosts, fiends and other flesh-eaters clapped their hands;

gurmukhi: ਜੱਛ ਗੰਧ੍ਰਬ ਅੳੁ ਸਰਬ ਬਿੱਦਿਅਾ ਧਰੰ ਮੱਧਿ ਅਾਕਾਸ ਭਯੋ ਸੱਦ ਦੇਵੰ ||
transliteration: Jachchh Gaddhrab Su Sarab Biddiaa Dharan Maddh(i) Aakaas Bhayo Sadd Devan||
translation: The Yakshas, Gandharvas and gods specialist in all science moved in the sky;

gurmukhi: ਲੁੱਥ ਬਿਦੁੱਥਰੀ ਹੂਹ ਕੂਹੰ ਭਰੀ ਮੱਚੀਯੰ ਜੁੱਧ ਅਨੂਪ ਅਤੇਵੰ ||੩੮੯||
transliteration: Loutth Bidoutthard Hooh Koohan Bharimachcheeyan Juddh Anoop Atevan||389||
translation: The corpses were scattered and on all the four sides the atmosphere was filled with terrible din and in this way the terrible war made a unique advancement.389.
